main event: Multiple sightings of a round, orange/yellow object at Cannon AFB and Clovis, New Mexico on May 4, 1964.
interesting points: The object was first observed at a 45-degree elevation and 270-degree azimuth,The sightings occurred approximately 30 minutes apart,Approximately four sightings reported,The object maneuvered by twinkling for 5 minutes,Weather was clear with strong winds at higher elevations.
witness description: Control tower operators and a station agent from Trans-Texas Airways
